wikipedia_page.main: Norman Field (second quarter 1936 – 13 January 2008) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1950s and 1960s. He played at representative level for Great Britain, and at club level for Lockwood ARLFC (in Lockwood, Huddersfield), Batley (two spells) and Featherstone Rovers (Heritage No. 383), as a wing, i.e. number 2 or 5.

response: The regiment's rugby league internationals include: Brian Curry, England, 1956; Norman Field, GB, 1963; Roy Sabine, GB; Jack Scroby, Army 1959, GB Halifax & Bradford Northern; Charlie Renilson, Scotland, GB, 1965 and Arthur 'Ollie' Keegan, GB.
*Norman Field (b. 1939), English rugby league footballer who played in the 1950s and 1960s.
* Norman Field won a cap for Great Britain' while at Batley in 1963 against Australia
